item.title: Hangout Highlights – Using Physics, Creating Joints, and Making Objects Interact
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: Last week on Corona Geek Hangout 146, we looked at working with Corona's built in physics engine to create draggable rag dolls, physics bodies, touch joints, and pivot joints. We even look at observing and troubleshooting physics objects using hybrid mode. Here are a few clips from the Hangout.
item.content:encoded:
Last week on Corona Geek Hangout 146, we looked at working with Corona’s built in physics engine to create draggable rag dolls, physics bodies, touch joints, and pivot joints. We even look at observing and troubleshooting physics objects using hybrid mode. Download the code from the Hangout to see how the examples work.

item.content:encoded:

Today we cracked open the can of joy that is the Box2D physics engine. We created a Draggable Rag Doll, used physics bodies, touch joints, and pivot joints. Â Then, we raced into motors and made a simple two wheeled car.
